New Records: Lockie Ferguson made history as he bowled four maidens to return the format's most economical figures, taking 3/0 against Papua New Guinea, playing a big hand in his team's seven-wicket win.
Ferguson's brilliant achievement is just the second time in men's T20 Internationals that a bowler has got through a full four overs without conceding a run.
Key Match Events: Ferguson's three wickets helped New Zealand tie Papua New Guinea in knots throughout the first innings in Trinidad.
Devon Conway put his team well on course with 35 from 32 balls, before Kane Williamson (18*) and Daryl Mitchell (19*) finished the job with 46 balls to spare.
Kabua Morea took 2/4 in his 2.2 overs, accounting for both Allen and Ravindra.
Semo Kamea was the other PNG wicket-taker, having Conway trapped lbw for 35.
Pre-Game Insights: After rain had delayed the start of play it was New Zealand who won the toss and opted to bowl first, with Trent Boult making his last appearance at a T20 World Cup.
Post-Match Reflections: For Papua New Guinea that is not perhaps a shock, but for New Zealand, losses to Afghanistan and West Indies ended their campaign before it had barely begun â€“ a hugely disappointing outcome for a side who were ranked fifth in the world at the start of the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: New Zealand pacer Lockie Ferguson did the unthinkable in his four-over spell, not conceding a single run as he took 3/0 to set a new world record in the format in the T20 World Cup 2024 match against Papua New Guinea.
Others: Only three PNG batters reached double figures, with Norman Vanua hitting 14 from 13 late on to help stretch out the innings.
